summary: DT*: THE CONTACT STATED THE MICROWAVE OVEN IN THE TRAILER IS DEFECTIVE.  THERE HAS NOT BEEN AN ELECTRICAL SHORT INVOLVING THE MICROWAVE.  THE CONTACT UNPLUGGED THE MICROWAVE TO AVOID AN ELECTRICAL SHORT AND IS THEREFORE UNABLE TO USE IT.  THERE WAS A RECALL LETTER RECEIVED IN NOVEMBER 2005 CONCERNING RECALL, # 03V383000 ON THE VEHICLE REGARDING THE EQUIPMENT.  THE PARTS NEEDED TO REPAIR THE VEHICLE ARE NOT AVAILABLE AT THE LOCAL DEALERSHIP.  THE MANUFACTURER CONFIRMED THE PARTS ARE NOT AVAILABLE.

2003 JAY FLIGHT 27BH TRAILER BRAKES LOCKING UP.  *BF  THE CONSUMER TOOK THE RV BACK TO THE DEALER WHO STATED THE BRAKE LINES WERE TOO SHORT SO THEY HAD TO BE ADJUSTED. THE SCREEN HAD TO BE FIXED BECAUSE THE WERE NOT SEALED PROPERLY, THERE WERE GAPS BETWEEN THE SCREENS AND THE WINDOW FRAMES. THE CONSUMER ENCOUNTERED OTHER PROBLEMS SUCH AS THE SHOWER WALL SEPARATING FROM THE CORNER WHICH CAUSED THE WALL TO BULGE, THE FRESH WATER TANK WAS NOT PROPERLY TIGHTENED SO WHEN THE CONSUMER USED IT FOR THE FIRST TIME WATER LEAKED ALL OVER THE FLOOR AND SOAKED THE CARPET. THE MOUNTING WHICH HELD THE DRAWERS IN PLACE FELL APART, THE WATER HEATER STOPPED WORKING, ALL OF THE SCREWS WHICH HELD THE SEATING AROUND THE TABLE FELL OUT, HE WATER PUMP WAS VERY LOUD. *JB
CONSUMER DISCOVERED THAT THE RIGHT SIDE ELECTRICAL BRAKE LINE WAS NOT HOOKED UP ON THIS TRAVEL TRAILER FROM THE MANUFACTURER PLANT. DEALER WAS NOT NOTIFIED .  *AK
